sentences.english: Base on new sources, this is a chilling story masterfully told.
sentences.chinese: 新源基地，这是一个令人心寒的故事巧妙地说。

sentences.english: What disappoints me most is that the five conservative justices are all soi-disant Catholics.
sentences.chinese: 让我最心寒的是五个保守派大法官都自称天主教徒。

sentences.english: Any disputes will only be chilling.
sentences.chinese: 任何纷争都只会让人心寒。

sentences.english: This is an incredibly sad story which gave me chills.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个让人悲哀的故事，看过之后让我一阵心寒。

sentences.english: I love you and I are from this kind of chilling to Wang Yan I love you.
sentences.chinese: 我爱你和我都从这种令人心寒的，以王艳我爱你。
这些统计数据令人心寒。

sentences.english: It saddens me what a corrupt country we've become.
sentences.chinese: 想到我们的国家变得这么腐败真令我心寒。

sentences.english: The sight sends a chill to my heart.
I think that no matter how kind intimidating people is chilling.
sentences.chinese: 我想这不管是怎么样都挺让人心寒的。

sentences.english: In facts, that was a chilling comment to me.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，我对这个评论感到心寒。

definition: shiver all over though not cold/tremble with fear/shudder
to feel distressed about sth/heartache/cardiac pain
lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless
to have one's hair stand on end (idiom)/to feel one's blood run cold
see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
